In this work, we investigate aqueous solutions of azobenzene star molecules with a planar benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxamide (BTA) core and three azo arms (azo–BTA star, see Figure 1a). This star is rigid and quasi planar in its all-trans state, as recently confirmed by us [ 14, 29]. Its BTA core is a well-known supramolecular entity in colloid science, used for the fabrication of dynamic and responsive materials [ 40, 41, 42, 43, 44, 45, 46]. The interactions between BTA molecules are inherently dynamic and involve hydrogen bonding between three amide groups,
